brief:
Multiplies the current matrix by the one specified in the
 parameter
name: applyMatrix()
description: Multiplies the current matrix by the one specified through the parameters. This is very slow because it will try to calculate the inverse of the transform, so avoid it whenever possible. The equivalent function in OpenGL is glMultMatrix().
syntax: applyMatrix(n00, n01, n02, n10, n11, n12)

parameters.name: n00
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n01
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n02
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n10
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n11
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n12
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n03
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n13
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n20
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n21
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n22
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n23
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n30
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n31
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n32
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied

parameters.name: n33
parameters.description: numbers which define the 4x4 matrix to be multiplied
